descriptions.description: More core developers increase the availability of mentors, facilitating implicit knowledge sharing.
A larger pool of new contributors increases the potential inflow of individuals who can be mentored.
As new contributors skill up, they flow out of the 'New Contributors' stock into more experienced roles.
Developer turnover directly reduces the stock of core developers as they leave the project.
Promoting experienced contributors directly increases the stock of core developers.
Promoting experienced contributors directly reduces their stock as they move into core roles.
The skill-up flow directly increases the stock of experienced contributors from the pool of newcomers.
Better documentation provides explicit knowledge, accelerating the learning and skill-up rate.
Effective mentorship provides tacit knowledge, accelerating the learning and skill-up process.
Mentorship builds competence and social integration, increasing the likelihood of promotion to core roles.
